description:
These 12-point technical mountaineering crampons can be used for anything from snow to steep ice. The versatility comes from the T-intersecting front points. They're engineered for strength when front-pointing, but will also prevent shearing in softer conditions. The secondary points angle forward aggressively with a hooking notch.

  • Chromoly steel is heat treated to increase fatigue strength
  • Leverlock system includes 2 interchangeable front attachment bindings for boots with a front welt (Fil systen) and those without (Fil Flex)
  • Linking bar can be set for flexible or semi-rigid to flexible or rigid boots
  • Wide front points hold solidly in soft ice
  • Secondary points are toothed and angled for purchase and support when front-pointing
  • Third row of points to optimize bite on hard snow slopes
  • Rear teeth and side points add stability when descending and traversing
  • Anti-snow plates included to prevent snow build-up
name: Petzl Sarken Leverlock Universal Crampons
